intro: Krynitzkia ramosa, commonly known as the branched krynitzkia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features succulent stems that are often branched, giving it a shrub-like appearance. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually yellow or orange, blooming in summer. Krynitzkia ramosa is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
